snippet: The secretary of state, in Beijing, warned that if necessary, the United States would take security steps China’s leaders have strongly opposed.

byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: Jane Perlez reported from Beijing, and David E. Sanger from Washington. Choe Sang-Hun contributed reporting from Seoul, South Korea

lead_paragraph: The secretary of state, in Beijing, warned that if necessary, the United States would take security steps China’s leaders have strongly opposed.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry tells Chinese foreign minister United States will take necessary steps to defend itself from long-range nuclear weapon North Korea is reportedly developing; warns reluctant Chinese leaders to rein in their neighbor or accept American actions, including installation of missile defense system in South Korea.

headline.print_headline: Kerry Urges Chinese to Curb North Korea’s Expanding Nuclear Pursuits
headline.main: John Kerry Urges China to Curb North Korea’s Nuclear Pursuits
